text: ==Events== ===March=== * March 25 – The first railway passenger service begins, on the Oystermouth Railway in South Wales. The cars are drawn by horses. ===May=== * May - closure of the Low Moor Waggonway ==Births== === March births === * March 27 – James P. Kirkwood, designer of Starrucca Viaduct (d. 1877). === November births === * November 5 – Oliver Ames Jr., president of Union Pacific Railroad 1866–1871, brother of Oakes Ames (d. 1877).Spencer Marks (2005). The Ames Family of North Easton, MA . Retrieved December 29, 2005.Union Pacific Railroad. Union Pacific: Significant Individuals . Retrieved December 29, 2005. === December births === * December 16 – William H. Aspinwall, American financier who helped build the Panama Railway (d. 1875).William Henry Aspinwall. Retrieved February 9, 2005. ==Deaths== ==References==
title: 1807 in rail transport
